content.description: the crux is moving onto and off of the rail then topping out.  move slow and use your balance.
content.location: this is on the right side of this section

content.description: There is a crux at the start and another towards the top as the arete  steepens,luckily the feet get larger the higher you go.  The landing is very flat and soft.
content.protection: Hard to even solo top rope this one (I climbed it this way and falling off means your rope will slide along the edge as you swing to the right, possible hitting the ground); get a spotter and a pad.   Yes there are other trees to anchor too but either way, it is a traverse so you'll either slide left or right if you fall solo top roping it.
content.location: This is on the left side of the boulder which faces "Podlings" on The Dark Crystal Boulder. Top out to an easy hike off.

content.description: This boulder currently has two routes and may offer a few more on the opposite side.    A flat landing, shade, positive holds, good height, and close proximity to The Dark Crystal Boulder make this a worthy.
